citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
A current Program of Veterinary care was not available for review. The PVC and IACUC documentation had been
destroyed by a natural disaster which had occurred in December 2022. All documentation must be kept updated with the
current information for the Attending Veterinarian and be available for review during APHIS inspections. The facility must
correct this issue.
*********Correct by June 1, 2023

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
Dog number #12 "Venetian" was observed in thin body condition. According to medical records the dog had received a
physical examination by the Attending Veterinarian on 2/3/23 and was prescribed treatment for diarrhea with instructions
for diagnostic testing if no improvement. The initial treatment was administered as directed however there was no
documentation showing that the follow up testing was performed. Medical records indicate that the dog is still showing
signs of chronic diarrhea. The dog is currently being treated for anxiety, and according to facility personnel the dog is
very nervous while at the facility. Chronic diarrhea can be an indication of underlying health issues and can cause the
dog distress. The facility states that the dog is being adopted in the next few weeks and will be placed in a permanent
home. The facility must correct this issue by following the treatment plan as prescribed by the attending veterinarian.
******Correct by April 15, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
